description: Walk through the heart of Mayfair.  See Churchill’s first apartment, fascinating architecture, London's oldest plane trees, and a Banksy; and walk along (or rather above) the River Tyburn.

events.name: Guided Tour with Blue Badge Guide

factsheet.heading: Summary
paragraphs: We will walk through the heart of Mayfair, the most expensive square on the English Monopoly Board and still one of London’s most expensive districts. We will celebrate an area of strong connections with the United States, Churchill’s first apartment, the remains of an aristocratic garden, and will finish by walking along (or rather above) the River Tyburn.

Along the way, Rowan will show you some great twentieth century architecture, some of London’s oldest trees, an allegedly haunted house, the most inaccessible painting by Banksy, London’s famous guerrilla artist, and will end with London’s oldest logo.

Where Winston Churchill's parents lived following their marriage
The Henry Moore sculptures in New Bond Street

location.meeting_point: Meet outside Gilbert Street exit from Bond Street tube station
travel_info: Nearest train: Victoria, Charing Cross, st.pancras, King's Cross, Euston, Marylebone, Paddington

name: Mayfair Walk
